meanings.sent1: The old, seedy house had peeling paint and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: The seedy motel on the outskirts of town looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years.
meanings.sent3: Despite its seedy exterior, the little cafe served the best coffee in town.
meanings.sent4: The seedy alley behind the market was a haven for stray cats and pigeons.
meanings.sent5: The seedy neighborhood was known for its abandoned buildings and overgrown lots.

meanings.sent1: The seedy watermelon was bursting with juicy seeds.
meanings.sent2: The seedy strawberry had so many tiny seeds you could hardly taste the fruit.
meanings.sent3: The seedy pomegranate made a mess when it was cut open, seeds spilling everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The seedy tomato had so many seeds inside, it almost seemed like a fruit salad.
meanings.sent5: The seedy raspberry bush produced a bountiful harvest of sweet, tiny seeds.

meanings.sent1: The seedy character in the movie was always up to no good.
meanings.sent2: The seedy part of town was known for its crime and shady dealings.
meanings.sent3: The seedy politician tried to cover up his scandalous past.
meanings.sent4: The seedy nightclub was a hotspot for illicit activities.
meanings.sent5: The seedy reputation of the bar kept most respectable people away.
